key_changes: Updated quick start menu to display new TikTok Shop options
sections_modified: Main function - new TikTok Shop section

patterns_discovered.description: All new examples follow the established pattern of commented code blocks with descriptive comments, consistent formatting, and print statements for completion feedback
Each content type (Blog, Social, Amazon, Competitor, TikTok Shop) has a dedicated agent class, allowing for extensible and maintainable codebase
All example code is commented out, allowing users to uncomment specific examples to test without breaking the script
TikTok Shop examples use similar parameter structures to other agents (status filters, date ranges, save_to_file options)

gotchas_discovered.description: Examples 13-15 require 'access_token' parameter, but Example 12 does not, which could confuse users about which operations need authentication
The string 'your_access_token_here' is used as a placeholder in multiple examples, which users must replace before uncommenting - not immediately obvious this is a placeholder
Menu items are numbered 1-11 originally, then 12-15 added for TikTok Shop - if more agents are added, menu system may need refactoring for scalability

approach_outcome.approach_used: Direct extension of existing examples pattern
approach_outcome.description: Successfully added TikTok Shop integration to quick_start.py by following established conventions: importing the new TikTokShopAgent, adding 4 comprehensive commented examples covering core functionality (video script generation, product sync, analytics, order sync), and updating the menu system to display the new options

recommendations.rationale: Examples requiring access_token should include a comment explaining where/how to obtain it

recommendations.recommendation: Create a helper function for menu display
recommendations.rationale: As more agents are added, the hardcoded menu list becomes difficult to maintain; consider dynamizing the menu generation

recommendations.recommendation: Add comments distinguishing authenticated vs non-authenticated examples
recommendations.rationale: Users will benefit from clear visual separation between examples that require authentication and those that don't

recommendations.recommendation: Consider adding example workflow combining multiple TikTok Shop operations
recommendations.rationale: A realistic end-to-end workflow example (sync products → generate scripts → check analytics) would demonstrate practical usage
